places_with_reviews.name: Emerald Isle | Heritage Resort/ Alleppey
address: Kanjooparambil-Manimalathara, Chathurthyakary Post, near Nedumudy, Alappuzha, Kuttanad Taluk, Kerala 688502, India

reviews.text: This small hotel with 150 years of history really is a special place. The house is beautiful and has that certain something, there is a lot to see in the garden, we had an interesting tour and the location between the canal and the rice fields is ideal. The food was the best we have eaten in Kerala, fresh, flavoursome, with the spiciness tailored to the needs of the guests, really delicious. As there are only 7 rooms, the interaction with the guests is much more personal, extremely attentive and friendly. We also found the interaction with the other guests to be pleasant and enriching. Really a pitty that we were only there for one night!

I had the best days of my vacation in this homestay. The property is so beautiful, clean and well maintained. The surroundings are peaceful and stunning. Don't miss to cycle around, meet friendly people and see how the locals live. The staff goes above and beyond to make your stay feel special and meet your needs, they are lovely people. Also great massages and backwater tours are organized. Last but not least, the food is fresh and delicious. Don't think twice, do yourself a favor and go there!

Fantastic experience here. U absolutely loved the ambience here. The manner in which the place brings out the culture and tradition of Kerala is worth commenting. It is subtle but brilliantly designed. The rooms the furniture and the house itself is truly reminiscent of the history and culture of Kerala. You have access to this homestay both by water and road. The view from here is breathtaking and an absolute must visit   the service of the staff is also good. It is a very calm and serene place

Genuinely, without exaggerating - this is one of the most wonderful hosting experience I have had in my life. I fell badly sick during my trip here - but Vijo, the owner/manager walked more than a mile to make sure that I was taken care of- from getting me meds to booking doctor appointments etc and all with a smile on his face. Warm and considerate people. Refreshing, really.

The property, in itself is beautiful. Lush green with fishing ponds with an amazing view of the backwaters.

Accessibility isn't an issue as they provide a cab service for a reasonable price as well.

Beautiful converted farmhouse with a lovely family history which is explained on arrival by the friendly and helpful host alongside a refreshing welcome drink of passion fruit !

The room was big and spotless with a wonderful bathroom comprising of an inside and outside shower !
They had a kettle and clean drinking water available for the length of our stay.
The beds were very comfortable and the aircon and fan kept us nice and cool !

The food as plentiful and delicious. With fruit and traditional Indian style breakfast available and more European omelettes/ toast. Lunch was also brilliant, with local fish being served along side 3 different curries, rice, poppadoms and dessert !

The activities really stood out with everything from massages to bike tours on offer.
The evening tour, along the canals to the rice paddies to watch the sunset was a real highlight as well as a 3h boat tour. But makes sure you find time to explore the beautiful surroundings of the property itself !!

The host was so kind and really helped us make the most of our stay. Communicating with us clearly on WhatsApp, helping us organise activities and our taxi onwards.

Would highly recommend !

places_with_reviews.name: THE PAMBA HERITAGE VILLA

reviews.text:
We booked a room at the Pamba Heritage Villa for 2 of my friends. From giving good food to arranging cab for my friends to go around Mr. Rajeev was very efficient and helpful. In addition, we had also booked a houseboating at the same time for the 8 of us, which also included foreign nationals, and it was a wonderful experience. Rajeev was very professional and courteous.
Today, I have made my second booking at the Pamba Heritage Villa, a room for my Dutch friends and a houseboating trip. I would definitely recommend this place as the experience and the service are worth every penny.

Peaceful, well maintained heritage house. The host and staff are very friendly and helpful. The day we arrived we had one of the best sunsets (attached video). The cooked good home food, they also arranged for a shikara ride.
I would highly recommend.

Location is little away from the main road, last 0.5 kms not so wide road to reach the property. Other than this, everything was excellent, resort ambience, nice AC well maintained rooms, food, service and stay. You have the beautiful view of the backwaters from the property, it flows right by the side of this resort

Our stay was superb....we had 4 families together with children. The host Rajeev was so friendly and generous with his time. Nothing was too hard to organise given his local knowledge and contacts. The house keeping staff were so friendly and the food was absolutely delicious. Having the river in front was a beautiful experience and even though it was monsoon season it was never an inconvenience for us. We did a boat trip organised by Rajeev which was great. Although it did break down in between which added to the excitement!  The approach road is a bit narrow but can be negotiated by good drivers. Our Tempo van had to.stop about 100.meters before but Rajeev organised a vehicle to help those unable to walk that distance and even had the house keeping staff transport our luggage. On the whole a great experience and would highly recommend this for families wanting to spend quality time together

Amazing experience.  It was time well spent   by the river.

Couldn't ask for a better way to meet an old friend.. Rajeev. Thank you for hosting us and taking care of our every requirement.

places_with_reviews.name: Avees River Gardens
address: Punnakkunnam-Pulincunnoo Road, Alappuzha, Kuttanad Taluk, Kerala 688504, India

reviews.text: An excellent place to relax. Hand drawn winch over the river is an experience by itself. The service was excellent. Time can be spent just sitting by the river ....
I feel the place is little bit costly.
Nice location. A bit more parking space would have been ideal

Calm serene resort with lake view to one of its side and paddy fields to another .ponds with fishes are anothet attraction to the site. Courteous staff and great food made our stay worth memorable. Thanks to management team there for the best of class services

Great location..  boatway water channel on one side and  overlooking water logged fields on the other side filled with lotus and lilly plants.. absolutely fantastic local food made to order.. decent sized room with heritage rooms giving one a feel of traditional Kerala.. value for money..

places_with_reviews.name: Waters Edge Villas Kerala
address: P.O I-235 B, Ponga, Nedumudy, Kerala 688503, India

reviews.text: Our family stayed here for 2 weeks in March / April and had nothing but a phenomenal time. Booked with Manoj and he connected me with his uncle Ramachandran Nair. Uncle went above and beyond to make sure we had a great stay. The Chef made us amazing food each day, catered to each of our requests and done it without any hesitation. He was so good with our kids and made them Poori and Chicken curry each time our lil one requested it. Mini chechi was the sweetest person to take care of our Villa, do our laundry and took care of all of our requests. Manoj's mom even took the time to come out and spend time there to ensure all of our needs were met. They've arranged a houseboat for us which picked us up right from the resort and had a great time on there as well. On our last day the family made a traditional Kerala meal for us and served on Banana Leaf! We couldn't be happier with their service, gesture and care. I'd strongly recommend Water's Edge Villa!

The stay there was soo excellent... The pool is well maintained. Better to take the villa with 5 bedrooms, all together for a family get-together. The food was awesome, the hospitality was awesome and the location is also awesome.... Only problem was that the pool is overdosed with chlorine, better not to wear dark shade dresses, it will be faded

As the name suggests the Villa is on the edge of back waters. Scenic and Spacious.  I stayed in this property for 5 days & 4 nights in October 2022 with my Wife & 2 Children (aged 7 yrs & 4 yrs). Mr. Nair the key care taker of the property takes charge of the guest and ensures that all needs of the guests are taken care. The food is catered in house and is made to taste. If you love Kerala food then you will relish the food served. The view from the resort is breathtaking. You will witness houseboats moving around the adjacent river 24x7.  Kids thoroughly enjoyed the swimming pool.

Points to consider while staying at this property:

- Being close to the Boat Jetty it gets a bit noisy with motor boats running round the clock.
- Parking is in a private property and on the other side of the river.
- One needs to cross a walking bridge to get to the resort. About 150-300 meters from parking.

Overall a beautiful and enjoyable stay.

Good place for having a mini get-together. Has around 11 rooms distributed in 3 villas, has a pool and nice ambience. The kayal is by the side of the location & there is a house boat pickup spot interior to the premises where they can pick up if u confirm the same prior. They will arrange all nicely cooked foods at prior confirmations. The only thing u find difficult is heavy chlorine content in the pool water which causes heavy irritation for eyes. Do carry the swim goggles to avoid the same. Rooms are quite ok too. Staff are cordial & will help u with ur requirements. Good and recommended place.

Good place and very polite and helpful staff. Only problem was the pool tiles broke off the night before we checked in. So couldn't use the pool. Breakfast and dinner which was provided was also very good. But currently the roads are under construction, so we were deviated through small narrow roads. Cars with low ground clearance will have issues.

places_with_reviews.name: Backwater resort
address: Champakulam ,Chennamkary, F95W+HWP, Alappuzha, Kainakary South, Kerala 688501, India

reviews.text: Super Great Accommodation from check in to check out everything was great they were above and beyond keep it up I highly recommended if you travel on this side choose this place please
The resort is very good and traditional,their hospitality is very good.

Frankly speaking, this was the worst home stay i ever had in my life. The food was so horrible. The most important thing to please a human is his food and in this place it was so pathetic.Some of the food tasted as if they brought it from some other hotels or some wear else.And also the roofing was leaky in most of the places and even in the bedroom.We had a rainy night and this happened.There was no inverter support and we slept without fan or A/C.Will never ever visit this place in my life again.Service is good.
Beautiful but deadly setting where one risks death by drowning especially when trying to alight from unsecured & dark houseboats!

Peaceful environment in the lap of nature.
It was a wonderful experience as the ambience, service , cuisine and ESPECIALLY staff all were excellent. Felt relaxed and happy during the entire stay.
Nice place to have a relaxed holiday. Close to Alappuzha town centre and to the market, at the same time away from all the hustles and bustles as the property is located at the river bank. The food is also good. Affordable .We all are really Enjoyed a lot ...... Great moments ever met together. SUPERB AROGYA INTERNATIONAL.

places_with_reviews.name: Akkarakalam Memoirs
address: Akkarakalam, Chennamkary Post Office, Pallathuruthy, Ponga, Alappuzha, Kainakary South, Kerala 688501, India

reviews.text: Great luxury houseboat experience. Highly recommend!

A nice enough location (right on the waterfront), but the place needs some investment.  The period architecture and fittings are potentially lovely but the old wooden doors don't close properly in some rooms and there's a general need for proper renovations.  The staff are friendly and accommodating.  Food; average.  Given the location you would expect mosquitoes to be a problem, and they were.  Some rooms have wonderful outside showers; just be wary of when the mossies might be out and about though.

Beautiful heritage property by one of the many canals of the Alleppey backwaters, far away from the hustle and bustle of Alleppey town. Accomodating, friendly and helpful manager and staff. They offered a complimentary boat ride and were very gracious about us changing our timings around a few times. Delicious homecooked food served in very generous portions.

However, the reason i'm giving only 3 stars is because there is still plenty of room for improvement - there was no hot water in our bathroom, no biscuits served with tea (a tiny but required creature comfort for elderly guests like my parents), dinner cannot be ordered after 8 pm as the cooks leave (they need to mention this in their details so that guests can come prepared) and there are no decent alternatives around, there are not enough side tables in the balcony.

There was a very noisy temple festival on next doors. This seems to be a yearly ritual. The property needs to let guests know about things like this so that they can make informed decisions about staying here.

Another peeve was the decor. It is a grand house with beautiful period furniture, so it's a shame that the upholstery, curtains, serveware and other decor items are so tacky. It would be lovely if they could accessorize the place with traditional and local textiles and crafts (it is an extremely rich region in that respect).

We came with cousins of ours for a daytime houseboat ride. It was a wonderful experience. The staff was courteous. The Kerala lunch was a delight and all of us (including the kids) were delighted by the experience. We would like to come back again.

Sadly the guesthouse no longer exists. It is now the hub for Spice Routes houseboats. The building has been refurbished and restored. It is still one of my favourite buildings as it still retains the original charm of Kuttanad!

places_with_reviews.name: Maria Heritage Homes

reviews.text: Recently me and my family stayed in maria heritage just for 1 day but all of us wanted to stay there more because of the hospitality of rema chechi and her husband,the peaceful atmosphere.we had very nice time there with yummy homemade kerala food.they even arranged kayaking and spa for us which was also wonderful..the whole property is aesthetic

Totally splendid. We really enjoyed our stay, as the name suggests home is decorated with some great antiques. With paddy fields behind and backwater at the front, Location is absolutely amazing. Host Rema mam and the entire team is very welcoming. Rooms are great and spacious. You can spend some wonderful time here with family and friends it's very peaceful and serene. I would really like to visit this place again. Food served is tasty and homely.

Maria Heritage Homes

This is easily one of the best ever homestay experiences we ever had. Such an extremely beautiful traditional house/bungalow with giant wooden swings, fish pond and scenic views all around.  This stands right on a strip of land which is sandwiched between backwaters at the front and paddy fields at the back. Rema Aunty and Mohan Uncle gave us a wonderful hospitality right from the moment we checked-in on our day one. Their hospitality with respect to every meal (breakfast - complimentary, lunch & dinner - prepared on request & payable) & evening coffee was making us feel like we were just visiting a lovely relative's home. They even prepared very early breakfast for us as we were to check-out before 7: 30 AM in the morning. Kudos and thanks to them.  As for the food, cook Mr. Raju gives the perfect Kerala Nadan cuisines at your preferred time of choice. Very yummy food. This is a must visit and the locality taken in consideration together with this amazing house offers the best worth for the price. The church we see in VTV movie is standing majestically on the other side of the backwaters.  You can even hop on a traditional hand-rowed wooden boat and enjoy a sunset ride on the water and reach the other shore too. Full recommendation to book this place and enjoy and get the worth to your last penny.

Super accomodation in a beautiful location in the heart of Kuttanad ( backwaters). Pampa river, right in front of the property and acres of lush green paddy fields at the back. Ms. Rama Mohan is a super host supported by a great team. Booked for 1 night but stayed for 3 nights as the room was available. Great place to chill and relax.

I recently stayed at Maria Heritage Home, a resort constructed in the traditional Kerala style. The delightful homely food served was a highlight, and the spacious, clean rooms with balconies added to the overall comfort of our stay. Highly recommended for a relaxing getaway.

Our stay at Maria Heritage Home was further enhanced by its lakeside location. Mrs. Rema, the manager, went above and beyond, organizing rejuvenating Ayurvedic massages and a memorable boat trip, allowing us to immerse ourselves in the breathtaking natural beauty surrounding the resort. A truly holistic and enjoyable experience.

We had the opportunity to speak with the owner, Mary Thomas. Her personal touch ensured that our stay was not only comfortable but also exceptionally enjoyable. The dedication of the owner truly reflects in the overall quality of the resort.

places_with_reviews.name: Captains Cabin Luxury Backwater Resorts
address: Thekkekara P.O, Nedumudy, Kuttanad Taluk, Kerala 688503, India

reviews.text: Amazing place! Nice clean and spacious rooms. The location is bang on the backwaters. You can get a boat ride rt from the property itself. Calm and serene surroundings away from the hustle bustle. The caretaker Suresh is very polite and helpful and ensures that you have a comfortable stay. Will definitely stay here again when I visit Alleppey next time.

My self with my family and relatives stayed at the resort for 2 days. We felt that this was a very nice resort located in a village surrounded by paddy fields on one side and the other side, a wide river. Its a very calm and quiet area which is suitable for relaxed life.
The staff and the facilities are so nice and the food they served was almost Kerala cuisine, especially the mango juice they served was delicious. Thanks to the staff for the services extended to us.
It was a wonderful stay so I recommend this resort is a right place to relax.
Wishing the staff, all the best.

In my 32 years of visiting Kerala,first time found a Home Away from Home.
Excellent service, food, ambiance and everything. The owner herself takes care of our requirements. Nothing to complain. Would recommend for any short or long stay.Special mention of Suresh. All in one.

Very cosy stay provided on the banks of the lake. Has an amazing view at an affordable price. The place is beautiful and quiet. The rooms are spacious and we'll maintained and the service is also very good. Highly recommended for people planning to stay away from the town. The rural setting provides opportunities for walks along the roads and fields and enjoying the beauty of nature.

Captain Cabin Resort Location is Fantastic.One side with water and other side with Paddy.
People who work there Kind, very Friendly, down to Earth behaviour ready with any type of help you been asking for
Food is amzing, there is no words about food.If I give 5 star for the food , I think it's not enough.
The Owner of the place was ready with any help with transportation or any other help.
I highly recommend this place for anybody who wants to have a great holiday.
We are looking forward to have  a relaxing time  and fabulous food whenever we go to India.Words are not enough to praise this place.Amazing,Amazing,Amaizing.👍

places_with_reviews.name: Kuttanad Kayak Club
address: Kuttanad Kayak Club, Paruthickal House, Pulincunnoo P.O Near Pulincunnoo, Panchayat Office Rd, Alappuzha, Pullinkunnu, Kerala 688504, India

reviews.text: The resort provided a delightful escape with its picturesque surroundings and luxurious amenities. The well-maintained facilities, attentive staff, and diverse recreational options made for a memorable and relaxing stay. The culinary offerings were exceptional, catering to various tastes. While the pricing reflected the quality of service, the overall experience justified the cost. Highly recommended for those seeking a tranquil and indulgent getaway.

Our time at the Riverside Cottage was nothing short of unforgettable.
The family's attentive service, combined with cozy accommodations, made for a delightful retreat. Kayaking on the river was a highlight, and the gourmet meals cooked by the family were simply divine. A perfect getaway for those seeking relaxation and adventure in equal measure. Highly recommended and would love to spend time at the riverside cottage.
Thankyou Hormese 😊

Such a wonderful stay! The house is charming and unique, the food was the best we had in Kerala so far, and the host is very helpful with arranging everything. We did kayaking in the morning and it was an unforgettable experience. Highly recommend!

Had an amazing stay. Host was really nice and polite. They served us amazing breakfast as well. Also enjoyed kayaking! Overall its an amazing place to chill and have fun with friends and family. I would highly recommend everyone to come here and stay.

Great ambiance,My stay at kuttanad kayak club was truly exceptional, leaving me thoroughly impressed with every aspect of the experience. From the moment I stepped into the property, I was greeted with warmth and professionalism by the attentive staff, setting the tone for a memorable stay.

The homestay ambiance exudes luxury and elegance, with tastefully decorated rooms that offer both comfort and sophistication. The attention to detail is evident in every corner, from the plush bedding to the modern amenities provided. The room's cleanliness was impeccable, ensuring a pleasant and relaxing environment throughout my stay.

places_with_reviews.name: Tulsi Kayal Retreat
address: Pally Jetty, Kainakary Pooppally Road, Chennamkary, Kainakary South, Kerala 688501, India

reviews.text: This was one of the most beautiful experiences I have ever had. I have been to Alleppey before, but this stay was a different experience altogether. As we arrived, we were received by a boat to get us to the stay, which was pretty exciting. The other side of the river was the beautiful homestay. It has spacious rooms, lip-smacking food, amazing view with  impressive location making it a great place to chill with family and friends. By evening, you can sit on the patio and witness the calming sunset by the river. If you are interested, you can go fishing. We took a shikara ride one of the days; it was all worth it. I must say that you will feel at home, and there is a peculiar kind of happiness here. I loved all the days that I stayed here. I would highly recommend this place! Go for it! 😊

The homestay is located in the middle of the backwaters right on the water. Therefore, getting there is a little more complicated, but doable, especially by boat from Aleppey. There is a very nice hammock from which you can watch the hustle and bustle on the river and enjoy the peace and quiet surroundings. The room is very basic, but the bed linen and towels are clean. The food is freshly cooked, very tasty and reasonably priced. Wifi works great.

Ashique took great care of everything and was always available via WhatsApp. He helped me book a bus and organized a boat transfer and a tuktuk for my onward journey. Thanks a lot!!
Amazing backwater location! Plenty of water activities. Once you get there you wouldn’t want to leave the place, tranquility at its best. They serve the best food and take care of you like family.
This place is not very touristy, quite and away from the hussle. This place gives the exact feel of how people of back waters live.
Excellent Retreat.  Feels like to visit again and again.
